intro: Lychnis preslii, commonly known as the slender campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are often arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. Lychnis preslii is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its historical use in traditional medicine.
